alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 28 at 7:26AM CDT until April 28 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING FOR THE LOWLANDS OF SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH CENTRAL NEW MEXICO, THE LOWER AND MID ELEVATIONS OF THE GILA, AND EXTREME FAR WEST TEXAS... .A passing storm system will push through southern New Mexico today bringing breezy to windy conditions with persisting dry air over areas west of the Rio Grande Valley. Temperatures will be seasonably warm for the western areas, but cooler for eastern areas due to a front moving through this morning. North to northwest winds will be 20-25 MPH with gusts 30-35 MPH. Strongest winds will be along and east of the Rio Grande Valley. Minimum RH will be 7- 12 percent across areas west of the advancing front. Behind the front, cooler temperatures will help to raise relative humidity above RFW criteria, but shifting winds will remain strong. Fire weather conditions will improve through the evening as winds subside and relative humidity rebounds above critical levels. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR FOR STRONG WINDS AND DRY CONDITIONS... * WIND...Northwest winds at 20 to 25 MPH and gusts 30 to 35 MPH. * HUMIDITY...Minimum relative humidity 7 to 15 percent. 16 to 25 percent for areas along and east of the Rio Grande Valley. * COLD FRONT AND WIND SHIFTS...An initial cold front will push into the region from the South Plains this morning. Winds will turn northerly and northeasterly this morning across the Sacramento mountains, and the lowlands east of the Rio Grande. A secondary push will occur around mid day today brining stronger northeast to east winds in these areas. This second push will continue west into the afternoon hours. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended. Operational impacts due to abrupt wind shifts should be considered due to the approaching and passing cold front.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
